election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1809 U.S. House of Representatives, District 1, Special

overview.note: This special election was held to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Benjamin Say.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 13 reports 2534 total votes for Adam Seybert in Philadelphia City.
The Democratic Press (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 2634 total votes for Adam Seybert in Philadelphia City.
The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 2634 total votes for Adam Seybert in Philadelphia City.
The Pennsylvania Democrat (Philadelphia, PA) from October 13 reports 2634 total votes for Adam Seybert in Philadelphia City.
The Freeman's Journal and Columbian Chronicle (Philadelphia, PA) from October 20 reports 2295 total votes for Richard R. Smith in Philadelphia City.

sub_unit.name: Cedar
sub_unit.note: The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 286 votes for Adam Seybert in Cedar Ward.

sub_unit.name: Chesnut
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 120 votes for Adam Seybert and 167 votes for Richard R. Smith in Chesnut Ward.

sub_unit.name: Dock
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 13 reports 122 votes for Richard R. Smith in Dock Ward.

sub_unit.name: Lower Delaware
sub_unit.note: Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 324 votes for Adam Seybert in Lower Delaware Ward.
The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 324 votes for Adam Seybert in Lower Delaware Ward.
The Pennsylvania Democrat (Philadelphia, PA) from October 13 reports 324 votes for Adam Seybert in Lower Delaware Ward.

sub_unit.name: Middle
sub_unit.note: Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 109 votes for Adam Seybert in Middle Ward.
The Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 109 votes for Adam Seybert in Middle Ward.
The Pennsylvania Democrat (Philadelphia, PA) from October 13 reports 109 votes for Adam Seybert in Middle Ward.

sub_unit.name: North Mulberry
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 328 votes for Adam Seybert in North Mulberry Ward.

sub_unit.name: South
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 77 votes for Adam Seybert in South Ward.

sub_unit.name: East Southwark
sub_unit.note: The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 155 votes for Adam Seybert in East Southwark Township.

sub_unit.name: East
sub_unit.note: The United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 and October 16 reports 491 votes for Richard R. Smith in the East Ward of Northern Liberties Township.
The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 491 votes for Richard R. Smith in the East Ward of Northern Liberties Township.

sub_unit.name: West
sub_unit.note: The votes cast in Penn Township are included in the returns from the West Ward of Northern Liberties Township.

sub_unit.name: Passyunk
sub_unit.note: Poulson's American Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 174 votes for Adam Seybert and 34 votes for Richard R. Smith in Passyunk Township.
The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) from October 12 reports 174 votes for Adam Seybert and 34 votes for Richard R. Smith in Passyunk Township.
The United States' Gazette (Philadelphia, PA) from October 11 reports 174 votes for Adam Seybert and 34 votes for Richard R. Smith in Passyunk Township.
The Chester and Delaware Federalist (West Chester, PA) from October 18 reports 174 votes for Adam Seybert and 44 votes for Richard R. Smith in Passyunk Township.

sub_unit.name: West Southwark
sub_unit.note: The Chester and Delaware Federalist (West Chester, PA) from October 18 reports 210 votes for Adam Seybert in West Southwark Township.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Pennsylvania State Archives, Harrisburg.
